articles.title: China Fires Laser to Moon and Back in Daylight for the First Time
articles.description: China has successfully fired a laser from Earth to the Moon and back during daylight for the first time. This breakthrough supports future Moon missions and space communication systems.
articles.content: China has successfully launched a precision laser from Earth, traveling 80,778 miles (130,000 kilometers) to the Moon and returning in broad daylight, marking a significant milestone for space exploration. The Deep Space Exploration Laboratory (DSEL)... [1101 chars]

articles.description: After more than 20 years in the making, we're finally about to see the first images from the Vera C.
articles.content:

articles.title: SpaceX launch from California sends 26 Starlink satellites into low Earth orbit
articles.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket placed 26 Starlink internet broadband satellites into low Earth orbit, lifting off from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on June 16, 2025.
articles.content:
SpaceX launched 26 Starlink satellites from California on Monday evening (June 16).
A relatively new Falcon 9 rocket, making only its third flight, lifted off at 8:36 p.m. PDT local (11:36 p.m. EDT or 0336 GMT June 17) from Space Launch Complex 4 Eas... [1409 chars]
